cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DL 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of natural language processing (cs.CL) because it focuses on automatic document summarization, which is a common task in NLP. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of linguistic devices in summarization, which is a key aspect of NLP research. 

The paper may also belong to the information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-category because document summarization is often used as a tool for information retrieval. 

The sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG) is also a possibility because the paper discusses the development of more sophisticated models for summarization, which could involve the use of machine learning techniques. 

The sub-category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI) is also a possibility because automatic document summarization is a task that falls under the umbrella of AI research. 

Finally, the sub-category of deep learning (cs.DL) is a possibility because the paper discusses the use of a hidden Markov model, which is a type of neural network commonly used in deep learning.
